meanings.definition: (verb) to store (beer) in a cool place for aging and maturing
meanings.sent1: The brewmaster lagered the beer in the cellar for several months.
meanings.sent2: The brewery lagered their signature ale to perfection before releasing it.
meanings.sent3: Why did the beer refuse to be lagered? It wanted to stay young forever!
meanings.sent4: The beer, lagered to excellence, was a masterpiece of patience and craftsmanship.
meanings.sent5: The process of lagering transforms the beer into a smooth and flavorful drink.

meanings.definition: (adjective) having been stored in a cool place for aging and maturing
meanings.sent1: The lagered ale had a rich and mellow taste that delighted the palate.
meanings.sent2: The brewery offered a selection of lagered beers that had been carefully aged.
meanings.sent3: The lagered beer was so cool, it could have its own fan club!
meanings.sent4: Her patience was like a lagered wine, growing more refined with time.
meanings.sent5: The lagered brew had a depth of flavor that only comes from proper aging.
